description:
AUFWERTEN stands for Agroforestry Environmental Services for Value Creation and Energy and is a joint project funded by the Federal Ministry of Education and Research (BMBF).
Representatives from six institutions are collaborating in the innovation group of the same name: BTU Cottbus-Senftenberg, Technical University of Munich, Leibniz Institute of Agricultural Engineering Potsdam-Bornim e.V., Biomasse-Schraden e.V., Domin Agricultural Enterprise, and the Kleine Elster Municipal Administration.
Other directly involved, as of now, are NABU e.V. (Brandenburg State Council, Senftenberg Regional Council), the Office for Applied Landscape Ecology and Scenario Analysis (BALSA), the University of Stuttgart, the VorSicht Atelier for Communication, the Zittau-Görlitz University of Applied Sciences, and the University of Bayreuth.
programme: Federal Ministry of Education and Research Germany
name: Agroforstliche Umweltleistungen Für WERTschöpfung und ENergie
